title: 'You're Chinese': Indian harassed at Shanghai airport; demarche issued, say govt sources
content: An Indian national from Arunachal Pradesh faced an 18-hour ordeal at Shanghai Pudong Airport, with Chinese immigration officials deeming her passport invalid due to her birthplace. Prema Wangjom Thongdok, a UK resident, was allegedly told Arunachal is not part of India. The Indian embassy intervened, resolving the issue.

title: Farewell to Bollywood's 'He-Man': Esha Deol breaks down; Big B, Salman attend last rites
content: Bollywood icon Dharmendra passed away at his Mumbai residence on November 24. The legendary actor's cremation was conducted swiftly, with many industry colleagues and family members, including Hema Malini and the Deol family, in attendance to pay their final respects. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu mourned his passing, acknowledging his significant contributions to Indian cinema.

title: Ethiopia volcano ash plumes: DGCA issues advisory; asks airlines to avoid affected region
content: India's aviation regulator has advised airlines to avoid flight paths and altitudes affected by volcanic ash from Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi eruption. Airports are inspecting runways for contamination, with flight disruptions anticipated as ash plumes move eastward towards Delhi and Jaipur.

title: 'Not easy task': Bengal CEO lauds BLOs amid SIR; seeks reports on 'work-pressure deaths'
content: Booth Level Officers in Kolkata protested against work-related stress during the special intensive revision of electoral rolls. The Chief Election Officer stated that District Magistrates have been asked to assist BLOs and investigate the deaths of four BLOs during the exercise. The protest highlights concerns over immense work pressure and its impact on BLOs' health.

title: Gemini 3.0 launch: Salesforce CEO says won't use ChatGPT again; praises Google’s AI model
content: Salesforce CEO Mark Benioff has declared his switch from ChatGPT to Google's Gemini 3.0. He experienced a significant shift after using Google's latest AI model. Benioff highlighted Gemini 3's improvements in reasoning, speed, image, and video processing. This move signals intense competition in the AI landscape, with other tech leaders acknowledging Gemini 3's success.

title: 'Sensitive time': Groom's sister Palak Muchhal breaks silence
content: Smriti Mandhana's wedding to Palash Muchhal has been indefinitely postponed due to her father's sudden hospitalisation.  Palak Muchhal confirmed the sensitive situation, requesting privacy.  Both Smriti's father and fiancé were hospitalised, though Palash has since been discharged.  The family is focused on Mr Mandhana's recovery, with his condition stable but requiring observation.

title: ISRO chief explains why students need more than just marks
content: ISRO chief V Narayanan has warned that India cannot afford to produce “mere bookworms”, backing value-based education and social–emotional learning over a marks-only culture. Linking his views with NEP 2020, OECD and WEF data, we argue that traits like self-control, respect, empathy and resilience shape employability, well-being and citizenship far more deeply than exam scores alone for today’s students.

title: ‘Victory will inspire’: PM Modi congratulates women’s kabaddi team; India wins World Cup
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the Indian women's kabaddi team for winning the Kabaddi World Cup 2025. India defeated Chinese Taipei 35-28 in the final, marking their second consecutive World Cup title and remaining undefeated throughout the tournament. The victory is expected to inspire young athletes.

title: Apple's warning to stores: Foreign SIM = penalty; outlets face closure risk
content: Apple distributors are warning Indian retailers against activating new iPhones, especially the iPhone 17 series, with foreign SIMs within 90 days, citing hefty penalties and store code blocking. This crackdown follows a surge in iPhone 17 models being diverted to high-margin markets like Russia, Africa, and the Middle East, causing domestic shortages. Retailers are pushing back against this mandate, arguing it unfairly targets them.

title: 'Soul of India': PM Modi to visit Ram Temple, hoist saffron flag; all you need to know
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Ayodhya on Tuesday to ceremonially hoist a saffron flag atop the Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Temple, marking the formal completion of its construction. The ceremony, coinciding with auspicious dates, will see the PM visit various temple precincts before addressing a public gathering.

title: Devils vs Red Wings: NHL preview, how to watch, timings, venue & prediction
content: The New Jersey Devils will host the Detroit Red Wings on November 24, 2025, at the Prudential Center. Despite injuries, the Devils are favored at -142, boasting a strong penalty kill and power play. Detroit, however, has a strong underdog record, making this an intriguing matchup with an expected high-scoring game.

title: Crash course! Crypto markets $1tn rout hits Trump family; what's extent of loss
content: The Trump family is facing financial setbacks from the recent plummet in the cryptocurrency market, particularly hit hard by a drop in their memecoin investments, Bitcoin mining operations, and crypto assets tied to their social media ventures. Nevertheless, Eric Trump maintains a positive outlook on the future of cryptocurrencies, perceiving these market dips as prime opportunities for investment.

title: Restoring old photos with Google Nano banana prompts, guide and tips
content: Google Nano Banana Pro revolutionizes old photo restoration, making it easier to revive faded images and repair damage.  Using advanced AI, it reconstructs details and textures naturally, preserving the original charm.  With precise prompts, users can achieve professional results, bringing cherished memories back to life without losing authenticity. This tool offers a gentle yet powerful way to honor the past.

title: Xi, Trump hold phone call; discuss US-China bilateral cooperation, Taiwan
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump held a phone call to discuss bilateral cooperation and Taiwan. Xi emphasized maintaining momentum in ties after their recent meeting and reiterated that Taiwan's return to China is a key aspect of the post-war international order.

title: Explained: Why your nose is bleeding when you sneeze, causes and prevention
content: Experiencing blood streaks after a sneeze can be alarming, but it's often due to common issues like dry air, allergies, or forceful sneezes irritating delicate nasal vessels. Understanding these triggers, from environmental factors to underlying health conditions, is key to effective treatment and prevention. Simple remedies and lifestyle adjustments can significantly reduce future occurrences.

title: Stefon Diggs’ partner Cardi B makes gold pendant from baby’s umbilical cord
content: Cardi B commemorated her fourth child's birth by transforming her umbilical cord into a gold pendant and her placenta into vitamins. This unique practice, offered by Mommy Made Encapsulation, also includes creating a "Tree of Life" placenta print. The service aims to preserve the initial bond between parent and child, a trend embraced by other celebrities.

title: Tom Brady’s on-air slip? Viral Cowboys-Eagles clip triggers debate online
content: Tom Brady stumbled over a player's name during a live broadcast of the Dallas Cowboys versus Philadelphia Eagles game. The incident occurred in the final minutes of the match. Social media users reacted to the verbal mix-up. Brady is in his second season as a commentator for FOX. The game itself saw Dallas achieve a historic comeback victory.

title: Gabrielle Union stunned in Rome as Dwyane Wade, Kaavia surprise her
content: NBA star Dwyane Wade surprised wife Gabrielle Union on her birthday in Rome, where she's filming a new project. The couple, along with their daughter Kaavia James, celebrated the occasion, with Union sharing heartwarming glimpses of the family reunion. This visit comes as Union gears up for her upcoming rom-com, 'Blame It On Rome'.

title: Pakistan overturns life ban on Arshad Nadeem's coach; terms action 'unconstitutional'
content: An adjudicator has overturned the life ban on Salman Butt, coach to Pakistan's javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem. Senator Pervez Rashid deemed the Pakistan Amateur Athletics Federation's action unconstitutional, citing a lack of due process. Butt is now free to continue coaching Nadeem and represent Pakistan internationally.

title: Not just play: Why Physical Education may be the smartest learning hour in school
content: A new meta-analysis finds that turning school Physical Education from lonely laps into structured, team-based activities can sharply improve children’s thinking skills, social confidence, physical competence and emotional resilience. With shared goals, clear roles and quick reflection built into games, the PE period becomes a powerful lab for better classroom learning, focus and engagement for children in today’s schools everywhere.

title: From Gaza to USA: How Twitter trolls were manufacturing consent and dissent
content: The chaos began with a small icon Musk probably assumed would be a cute transparency feature. Instead, it detonated the timeline. For years, people fought with strangers online under the illusion that these strangers lived nearby. That illusion collapsed the moment the map pin dropped. Suddenly, timelines were littered with patriots tweeting from Ankara, Gaza reporters posting from Krakow, and Ivanka Trump megafans tapping away from a quiet suburb in Lagos.

title: 'Why? Why? Why?': Angry Mamata shoots off letter to EC; flags 'disturbing' decisions
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has expressed alarm to the Election Commission over two "disturbing" developments concerning the state's election machinery. She questioned the outsourcing of data entry work by the Chief Electoral Officer and the proposal to set up polling booths in private housing complexes, citing concerns about fairness and potential political influence.

title: Toxic Delhi air: WFH order issued; govt, private offices to function at 50% strength
content: Delhi government issued advisory on Monday  for 50 per cent on-site staff for offices to combat rising air pollution, following directions from the Commission for Air Quality Management. This measure aims to reduce exposure and vehicular emissions, with staggered timings already in effect for government offices until 2026.

title: Can India’s new labour codes finally bridge the gender divide at work?
content: India’s new Labour Codes, enforced from 21 November 2025, attempt to bridge the long-standing gap between rhetoric and reality on women’s workforce participation. By mandating wage equality, enabling night-shift work with safeguards, formalising employment, expanding social security, and recognising gig workers, the Codes mark a structural shift toward safer, fairer and more equitable workplaces for women.

title: '10 kilo khoon kam ho gaya': Sachin pays tribute to Dharmendra; expresses grief
content: "I, like many others, took an instant liking to Dharmendra ji, the actor, who entertained us with his versatility. That on-screen bond became stronger off-screen when I met him. His energy was incredibly infectious, and he would always tell me, ‘Tumko dekhkar ek kilo khoon badh jaata hai mera.’ He had an effortless warmth, making everyone around him feel valued and special," Tendulkar wrote on X.

title: Delhi pollution protest: 22 sent to judicial custody; 'stir held without permit'
content: Seventeen protesters were sent to judicial custody in Delhi for demonstrating at India Gate against air pollution, bringing the total arrests to 22. Police reported protesters obstructed and assaulted officers, using pepper spray. Two FIRs were registered under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: BLO deaths: EC moves fast after audio surfaces of official; TMC sharpens attack
content: The Election Commission is addressing work-related stress among Booth Level Officers (BLOs) during Kerala's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls after an audio message went viral. This follows reports of BLO suicides and deaths due to excessive pressure in several states, prompting protests and criticism from political parties regarding the rushed and opaque nature of the revision process.

title: Warren Buffett’s wisdom: Essential tips to shape a strong long-term career
content: Warren Buffett's career lessons extend beyond investing, emphasizing treating your career like 'Me Ltd.' and understanding your 'circle of competence.' He advises planning in decades, creating a 'margin of safety,' and ignoring career 'Mr. Markets.' Building a personal 'moat' and continuous learning are crucial for long-term, compounding career growth.

title: Wedding postponed: Smriti removes marriage posts; father, fiancé hospitalised
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana has removed all wedding-related posts from her Instagram. This comes as her father, Shrinivas Mandhana, was hospitalised. The wedding ceremony, scheduled for November 23, has been indefinitely postponed. Her manager confirmed the postponement due to Mr Mandhana's health. The couple and families request privacy during this time.

title: Virat Kohli mourns Dharmendra: 'Today, we have lost a legend'
content: Indian cricket stars, including Virat Kohli, Deepti Sharma, Virender Sehwag, Harbhajan Singh, Kedar Jadhav, and Shikhar Dhawan, have paid heartfelt tributes to legendary Bollywood actor Dharmendra, who passed away at 89. IPL teams also joined in mourning the iconic actor, remembering his charm, talent, and enduring legacy in Indian cinema.

title: IND vs SA: Ashwin’s 'Mankad' reply for Marco Jansen goes viral
content: Ravichandran Ashwin humorously suggested it would be easy to 'Mankad' South Africa's Marco Jansen, while praising his talent. Jansen's impressive performance with both bat and ball in the ongoing Test match has put South Africa in a strong position to win the series. South Africa are closing on a first series win in India since Hansie Cronje's team triumphed in 2000.

title: 'Does a lot of dishes': Usha Vance reacts to missing ring
content: Second Lady Usha Vance clarified speculation surrounding her marriage after being photographed without her wedding ring. A spokesperson attributed the oversight to her busy role as a mother of three, emphasizing no deeper meaning. This follows recent online scrutiny of Vice President JD Vance's interactions at a conservative event and his comments regarding his wife's religious beliefs.

title: Areas close to waste-to-energy plants have Delhi’s worst air; Okhla, Ghazipur worst hit
content: Residents near Delhi's waste-to-energy plants endure severe pollution, with foul air and acrid odors plaguing their neighborhoods year-round. Despite burning thousands of tons of waste daily and emitting toxic pollutants, these plants are excluded from emergency pollution control measures like GRAP, leaving communities vulnerable to chronic and seasonal health impacts.

title: Siraj’s spidercam prank! Camera operator's response steals the show — Watch
content: Mohammed Siraj's lighthearted moment with the Spidercam offered a brief respite for Indian fans amidst a tough day 3 in Guwahati. South Africa dominated, with Marco Jansen's exceptional all-round performance, including 6/48, crippling India's first innings and bundling them out for 201. The Proteas did not enforce the follow-on and opted to bat again.

title: ‘Engraved with initials’: Titanic passenger's gold pocket watch sold for 1.78m pounds
content: A gold pocket watch belonging to Titanic victim Isidor Straus, Macy's co-owner, fetched a record 1.78 million pounds at auction. The 18-karat timepiece, which stopped at the moment the ship sank, was gifted to him in 1888.

title: 'Masks off, real faces out': BJP flays Cong; Hidma posters at pollution stir sparks row
content: BJP leader Sudhanshu Trivedi criticized protesters at India Gate for raising slogans supporting a slain Naxal commander, accusing them of being influenced by "pollution of Marx and Mao." The protest, initially against air pollution, saw demonstrators holding posters of Madvi Hidma, leading to arrests by Delhi Police for obstructing personnel and assaulting them.

title: Dharmendra passes away at 89: Singer Kamal Khan condoles
content: Legendary Bollywood actor Dharmendra passed away at 89 in Mumbai. Singer Kamal Khan paid tribute, calling him an inspiration whose journey from Punjab to cinema and connection to his roots touched souls. Dharmendra's demise marks the end of an era for fans and the industry.

title: Feel Low in Winter? Discover the Causes and Symptoms of Seasonal Affective Disorder
content: As winter's shorter days and longer nights arrive, many experience a dip in mood and energy, potentially indicating winter depression, a form of SAD. This condition, linked to light exposure and disrupted circadian rhythms, can be managed with strategies like maximizing sunlight, maintaining routines, and a balanced diet.

title: Dharmendra no more: Hindi cinema loses a legend; nation remembers his golden era
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra, Bollywood's 'He-Man', passed away in Mumbai at 89 after a brief illness. Renowned for a prolific career spanning six decades and over 300 films, including the iconic 'Sholay', the legendary actor leaves an indelible mark on Indian cinema. His final film, 'Ikkis', is slated for release next year. Dharmendra's legacy is celebrated for his versatility and charm.

title: India hit the Jansen wall again; South Africa closes in on historic series victory
content: India's batting collapsed spectacularly on day three in Guwahati, succumbing to poor decisions and shot selection against South Africa. Despite a pitch described as a 'road', India was bowled out for 201, with Marco Jansen claiming six wickets. South Africa, leading by 314 runs, is poised for a series victory, leaving India hoping for a miracle.

title: Pepper spray, Hidma posters and broken barricades: Protest over Delhi pollution stuns cops
content: A clean-air protest at Delhi's India Gate took a surprising turn as demonstrators displayed posters of slain Maoist commander Madvi Hidma. Police arrested 22 individuals for refusing to disperse, using chilli spray on officers, and blocking traffic. The incident occurred amidst severe air pollution levels plaguing the national capital.

title: School teachers to be mentored by professors: Here’s all about India's NMM initiative
content: The UGC has issued a new advisory asking universities to nominate senior faculty for the National Mission for Mentoring, a programme designed to link experienced academics with schoolteachers. The move aligns with NEP 2020’s plan to build a national mentoring system. Selected professors will guide teachers in pedagogy, digital literacy, foundational learning and other key areas through the NMM portal.

title: Vanes Martirosyan: American boxer dies at 39 after two-year cancer battle
content: Former U.S. Olympic boxer Vanes Martirosyan has passed away at 39 after a two-year fight with cancer. The world title contender, who represented the U.S. at the 2004 Olympics, was diagnosed with skin cancer in 2023. His family confirmed the heartbreaking news, remembering him as a loving husband, father, and kind soul.

title: Ethiopia volcano ash plumes: IndiGo flight to Abu Dhabi diverts to Ahmedabad
content: Ash plumes from Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi volcano eruption are moving east. These plumes are expected to reach Delhi and Jaipur. Indian aviation authorities are monitoring the situation closely. Airlines are also watching for potential impacts on flight movements. The ash is currently drifting beyond Oman. Officials hope the intensity will reduce as it travels.

title: Three Week 12 comeback wins and what they mean: Barnwell on the Cowboys, Chiefs, Lions
content: Dallas was down 21. Detroit was down 10. And Kansas City was down 11. What did we learn as all three rallied in the second half to win their games on Sunday?

title: Blazers' Billups pleads not guilty in poker case
content: Trail Blazers coach and basketball Hall of Famer Chauncey Billups pleaded not guilty on Monday to charges tied to his alleged role in rigged poker games involving Mafia figures.

title: Giants fire DC Bowen after another late collapse
content: The Giants have fired defensive coordinator Shane Bowen after New York blew a double-digit lead on Sunday for the fifth time this season, tying an NFL record.

title: Source: Tucker gets Saints tryout, 1st since ban
content: The Saints are bringing in former Ravens kicker Justin Tucker for a tryout, a source told ESPN, confirming multiple reports.

title: UConn women No. 1; UCLA, Texas enter 3-4 tilt
content: UConn passed its first test of the season to remain No. 1 in the AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll, ahead of South Carolina, UCLA and Texas.

title: 'Blessed' Kosar to be discharged from hospital
content: Browns great Bernie Kosar announced on social media that he is being discharged from the hospital Monday a week after he received a liver transplant, which came more than a year after he was placed on the waiting list.

title: Clark, Bueckers, Reese set for USA camp debuts
content: Caitlin Clark, Paige Bueckers, Angel Reese and JuJu Watkins will be among the 10 players making their USA Basketball senior national team camp debuts next month.

title: Reeling Raiders fire Kelly amid first year as OC
content: Chip Kelly is out as the offensive coordinator of the Raiders, a decision that came after the team's 24-10 loss to the Browns.

title: New Era: Big 12 nets $50M NIL hoops event deal
content: Big 12 announced Monday that it will get eight automatic bids to the Players Era Festival, in coming years, which will give every participant a guaranteed $1 million NIL payout.

title: Wetzel: Lane Kiffin has a near $100 million decision coming Saturday. He better win Friday
content: As the drama at Ole Miss drags on, there's a game to play Friday. And the pressure on Kiffin to win will be overwhelming.

title: What to know about Damon Jones, the man at the center of two NBA scandals
content: After making more than $21 million across 11 seasons in the NBA, the NBA journeyman fell hard -- and, prosecutors allege, into a life of crime.

title: Superlatives for the 2025-26 MLB free agent class, from Kyle Tucker to Alex Bregman
content: Surprise signings? Slugger or bust? Most impact? We've got a yearbook's worth of awards for the top MLB free agents.

title: Your guide to men's college basketball Feast Week: The 9 best games to watch
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to a showcase in New York City, here's what we're watching Thanksgiving week.

title: How Christian McCaffrey became a scrimmage yard king on the verge of NFL history
content: McCaffrey, one of the best receiving running backs in NFL history, plays his former team on "Monday Night Football."

title: From player to GM: Panthers' Dan Morgan, 49ers' John Lynch are in rare air
content: Only two of the 32 GMs played in the league -- and they took drastically different paths to get there.

title: Did Dallas' win set the table for a playoff run?
content: Dallas overcame a 21-0 deficit to beat its division rivals, but the path to the postseason remains tough.

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: The third in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: 'We're working to the end': How interim coaches handle their short time in charge
content: In a wild coaching carousel, this is the season of the interim coach. They talked about how to get through the season.

title: 30 best pro wrestlers under 30: Did 'Dirty Dom' repeat in 2025?
content: Who are the best young stars across professional wrestling? We rank the top 30 wrestlers under age 30.

title: Early NBA contender questions: How top 16 teams can keep playoff hopes alive
content: Our insiders answer one big question on the top NBA teams with title ambitions and explain what they need to do to stay a contender.

title: First-month lessons: What we're hearing on all 30 teams
content: Let's take the pulse of the league on OKC's chase for 70 wins, and more first-month standout storylines.

title: WNBA mock draft: UConn's Fudd is new No. 1 as Wings win lottery
content: Azzi Fudd is the new projected No. 1 pick after Dallas won the draft lottery for the second consecutive year.

title: Predicting the USMNT's starting lineup at the World Cup: What previous tournaments tell us
content: When the USMNT plays in a World Cup, there are always some locks, and always some players who come out of nowhere to start games.

title: Ranking Ronaldo's overhead kick goals for Real Madrid, Portugal, Al Nassr
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's 954th career goal was one of his best, adding to his collection of stunning acrobatic strikes. Here they all are -- ranked!

title: Liverpool's crisis deepens with another defeat, and more dropped points for Madrid
content: A bad season just keeps getting worse for Arne Slot and Liverpool, while Real Madrid also dropped points in a sluggish draw with Elche. Ga Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Which team should take Kenyon Sadiq in April?
content: We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 13, including why Kenyon Sadiq is TE1 and whether Utah could have two early-pick OTs.

title: Week 12 winners and losers: Gibbs notches highest score of season, Taylor goes quiet
content: Jahmyr Gibbs, Jaxon Smith-Njigba and Emanuel Wilson led the way with big Week 12 performances, while Jonathan Taylor, Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson and were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Buzz: Wilson shines as fill-in for Jacobs; Monangai takes over in Bears' backfield
content: Green Bay's Emanuel Wilson proved why it's critical to insure your top RBs by rostering their backup.

title: NFL futures: Rams leapfrog Eagles for Super Bowl favorite status
content: Updated 2025 NFL win totals and odds for every team to make the playoffs, win their division, conference and Super Bowl LX.

title: Early bets: Texans' defense to fluster Colts; four other plays to make
content: What lines offered value once odds came out? Here are five early bets to consider making going into Week 13.

title: Boys' 2026 recruiting class rankings: Michigan State up, Houston in, Duke far from finished
content: Missouri remains No. 1, with Michigan State at No. 2, Duke No. 3 and new adds Houston, Purdue, West Virginia.

title: Pickups: Time to add Collin Gillespie, Derik Queen, Jusuf Nurkic
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Weekly waiver pickups: Add these defensemen for assists, power-play points
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: How McLaren's microscopic Vegas DQ brought Max Verstappen into the title fight
content: A technical infraction as small as a hair's width saw both McLarens disqualified from Vegas, which has enormous ramifications for F1's title fight.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United ready to hand Onana's squad number to Semenyo
content: Manchester United are hoping they can lure Bournemouth winger Antoine Semenyo to Old Trafford. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Woman Claims Husband Injected Mercury Into Her 9 Months Ago, Dies Soon After Near Bengaluru
content: A woman who had been battling for life for nine months after reportedly being injected with mercury by her husband has died in Karnataka's Attibele, nearly 28 km from Bengaluru.

title: Delhi Pollution Protest: Court Sends 17 Protesters To 3-Day Judicial Custody
content: A Delhi court on Monday sent to three days' judicial custody 17 people arrested on charges of obstructing police personnel and assaulting them during a protest at the India Gate over rising air pollution levels in the national capital.

title: Man Posing As Prophet Mohammad's 'Descendant' Dupes Women Of Rs 11 Lakh
content: A 31-year-old man allegedly duped two women of around Rs 11 lakh in Mumbai by claiming to be a "descendant" of Prophet Mohammad and promising to double their gold jewellery and increase cash flow in their home, police said on Monday.

title: Mamata Banerjee Accuses Poll Body Of Bias Over Staffing, Polling Booth Plans
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday wrote a letter to Chief Election Commissioner (CEO) Gyanesh Kumar, demanding his "immediate intervention" into two recent issues.

title: Now, 5 Men Posing As Probe Agency Officials Rob Rs 3 Crore In Karnataka
content: Even as Bengaluru reels from a daring heist in which men posing as RBI officials escaped with over Rs 7 crore in cash, a major gold robbery has now been reported from Hubballi.

title: Offices To Work At 50% Strength, WFH For Rest As Toxic Air Chokes Delhi
content: Government and private offices in Delhi have been told to work at 50 per cent strength on site and the rest in work-from-home mode due to rising air pollution in the national capital.

title: 3 More Teachers Summoned In Delhi Class 10 Student's Suicide Probe
content: Delhi Police on Monday summoned three more teachers of St Columbia's School here for questioning in connection with the suicide of a Class 10 student over alleged mental harassment, an official said.

title: Highway Blocked As Protests Erupt Over Rape Of 6-Year-Old In Madhya Pradesh
content: Anger spilt onto the streets of Madhya Pradesh's Raisen on Monday as massive protests erupted over the rape of a six-year-old girl earlier this week.

title: Delhi Police To Frame Charges Against Murder Accused For In Absentia Trial
content: Delhi Police, for the first time ever, has exercised Section 356 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, which allows police to frame charges and the court to proceed with trial in the absence of absconding accused in serious cases, an official sa

title: Explained: Salary, Benefits And Working Hours Under New Labour Codes
content: From better salaries and retirement benefits to encouraging women's participation in the workforce, the new Labour Codes which were notified last week will bring a generational change in how India treats its workforce.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Reel Is Over, But The Light Remains: Remembering Dharmendra
content: From the moment he strode onto the silver screen in the early 1960s, a whirlwind of raw, rustic charm, Dharmendra was an instant phenomenon. He embodied the soul of a transitioning India: tough yet tender, deeply flawed yet utterly lovable.

title: Iconic Sholay 'Water Tank' Scene In Sharad Pawar's Tribute For Dharmendra
content: NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar on Monday condoled the death of Bollywood actor Dharmendra, recalling his immense contribution to Indian cinema and his iconic 'water tank' scene in the blockbuster 'Sholay'

title: Woman News Anchor Found Dead Inside Her Guwahati Office Weeks Before Wedding
content: A young woman journalist who worked as an anchor with a local news portal was found dead inside the office in Guwahati on Monday morning, officials said.

title: Akshata Murty On Cooking Rasam, Lighting Diyas At 10 Downing Street
content: Akshata Murty, businesswoman and wife of Britain's first Indian-origin prime minister Rishi Sunak, has shared some insights from the couple's life at Downing Street.

title: "Can't Do This Anymore": Noida School Teacher Resigns Over SIR Work Pressure
content: A woman, who was appointed as a Booth Level Officer (BLO), has resigned from her position as an assistant teacher in Noida.

title: Blocking Not Enough To Stop Spam Calls, Report On DND App: Telecom Regulator
content: Simply blocking phone numbers on mobile devices will not stop spam calls; instead, subscribers should report them through the Trai DND app, the telecom regulator said on Monday.

title: 3 Boys Killed While Playing With Rocket Propellant In Pakistan
content: Three children, aged between 8 and 12, were killed when a rocket propellant they were playing with exploded in Kashmore district in Pakistan's Sindh province, police said on Monday.

title: Explained: The Tax Trigger Behind Steel Tycoon Lakshmi Mittal's UK Exit
content: Indian-origin billionaire Lakshmi Mittal, long based in the United Kingdom, is reportedly leaving the country as the Labour government plans major tax reforms targeting high-net-worth individuals.

title: Jharkhand Minister's "Lock Up" Poll Officials During SIR Comment Sparks Row
content: A minister of the Congress in Jharkhand, Irfan Ansari, has sparked a massive row asking people to "lock up" the electoral officers when they visit homes as part of the voter list revision exercise

title: 'Teachers Troubled Him A Lot': Father On Delhi Teen's Suicide
content: Parents of a 16-year-old Class 10 student who allegedly died by suicide on Monday demanded strict action against those responsible, saying their son had been under severe mental stress due to alleged harassment by school teachers.

title: The best players and biggest moments of 2025
content: the 2025 professional tennis season has come to a close, and what a year it was . a number of surprise victors and compelling storylines combined to make one very memorable season . ESPN's Chris Evert, Sam Querrey and Pam Shriver voted on who should be named the ATP and WTA Players of the Year .

title: NHL's best this week: The case for a new 'playoff cutoff' date
content: 77.1% of NHL teams in a playoff spot on American Thanksgiving made the postseason . this season could be different: in the past 10 seasons, the average gap between top and bottling . if an NHL team is in playoff position by American Thanksgiving, they will probably make the playoffs .

title: Takeaways: Kiffin and the CFP, Notre Dame's style points and more
content: our college football experts break down key storylines and takeaways from Week 13 . did it clarify any of the Power 4 conference races? not really. Did it help solidify any part of the College Football Playoff field . the Ducks, ranked no. 7 in the CFP rankings, still hold an outside shot at returning to the Big Ten title game .

title: Phoenix Mercury update logo and uniforms in image rebrand
content: the Phoenix Mercury rolled out a rebranded image with new uniforms and logos . the new logo and uniforms were revealed during a private event in Phoenix on friday . a goal was to modernize a logo that the organization believed was true to the 1990s, he says .

title: MLB offseason grades: Judging the Nimmo-for-Semien swap for Mets, Rangers
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: Where the most chaos could be lurking on Rivalry Week
content: the penultimate week of the college football regular season gave us plenty of entertainment . we got an incredible comeback in Salt Lake City, we got some resounding blowouts and we got the best ending of the season at the Division II level . the ACC gave us more chaos thanks to Georgia Tech's no-show against Pitt .

title: The main thing to know from every Week 12 game: Rams sit atop NFC after Eagles' meltdown
content: the Cowboys beat the Eagles in overtime overtime . quarterback shedeur Sanders beat the Raiders in his first start . it was the first time a Browns quarterback won their first start since Eric Zeier in 1995 . the Falcons also bounced back, defying the defense's offense .

title: 📈 CFB Power Rankings: Two new teams join
content: americanC averaged 190.8 rushing yards across its first 10 games this fall . the no. 7 Ducks improved to 10-1 after a 42-27 win over the Trojans . it's a second straight college football playoff appearance in the 2025 season .

title: Liverpool on course to be worst-ever Premier League champions. Can Slot stop the rot?
content: arne slot's side are on course to be the premier league's worst-ever defending champions . the 47-year-old is floundering, so much so that his team is threatening to make history for the wrong reasons . liverpool spent £450 million on new signings this summer to cement their position as England's dominant force .

title: Let's overreact to Week 12: Is the J.J. McCarthy era already coming to an end?
content: the Minnesota Vikings are a good organization, and they made the decision to go all-in on quarterback J.J. McCarthy and ... well... it just has to get better one of these weeks, right? not this week . the Vikings have offensive line issues .

title: India issues strong demarche to China after Arunachal woman harassed at Shanghai airport
content: Prema Thongdok said immigration and airlines staff were “unprofessional and rude”, they laughed and mocked calling Arunachal Pradesh a Chinese territory

title: SBI Ventures plans to launch ₹2,000-crore climate-focussed fund in Jan-Mar
content: It will help unlock green growth, a new financial opportunity, SBI Ventures Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer Prem Prabhakar said

title: ‘Sankranti Sambaralu’ to be organised in NTR District during harvest festival
content: Andhra Taxi App to be launched, temples, tourist spots to be developed for the festival, says Collector

title: Supreme Court notice to government on plea to frame national compensation policy for unjust imprisonment
content: Petition seeks to recommend appropriate yardsticks for monetary and non-monetary relief, including counselling, livelihood assistance, and social reintegration

title: Modi to visit Ayodhya, hoist sacred flag at Ram Temple
content: The Dhwaja Rohan (flag-hoisting) ceremony signifies the completion of the Ram Temple’s construction; The event is taking place on the auspicious day of Vivaah Panchami.

title: West Bengal CM writes to CEC asking whether initiatives taken are at the behest of a political party
content: This is the second letter addressed by the Trinamool Congress chairperson to CEC; in her letter dated November 20, Ms. Banerjee had urged CEC Gyanesh Kumar to halt the SIR pointing out that the human cost of the management of the exercise has turned unbearable

title: Protests in M.P.’s Raisen over rape of 6-year-old girl; accused remains absconding
content: The girl was taken to a government hospital in neighbouring Obaidullaganj but was immediately referred to AIIMS, Bhopal where she is undergoing treatment

title: Navy gets its ‘silent hunter’, 80% home-grown INS Mahe
content: Army chief General Dwivedi launches warship, says in age of ‘multi-domain’ warfare, ‘true strength’ of the armed forces lies in ‘synergy’, adds that Army, Navy and Air Force form “the trinity of India’s strategic strength”

title: Maoists offer to surrender by February 15 in letter to three CMs
content: Special zonal committee of the banned Communist Party of India (Maoist) asks Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh to pause security operations as it considers the government’s rehabilitation programme

title: Certain clauses of Data Act lend themselves to ‘weaponisation’: PCI
content: They flagged serious lacunae in the DPDP Act, 2023, that impinge upon press freedom and directly hit Article 19 (1)

title: BEL, Safran sign JV to manufacture precision-guided weapon
content: The agreement was signed in New Delhi by BEL CMD Manoj Jain and SED Executive Vice President Alexandre Ziegler. Secretary (Defence Production) Sanjeev Kumar and Safran CEO Olivier Andries were present for the ceremony

title: HC sets aside order resuming nine acres land allotted to AAI
content: The order seeking resumption of the nine acres of land at Kancha Gachhibowli was ‘bereft of reasons’ and lacked jurisdiction

title: Elephant safaris resume in Corbett and Rajaji reserves after 7 years
content: Elephant safaris have been resumed in the Dhikala and Jhirna ranges of the Corbett Tiger Reserve (CTR) and the Cheela range of the Rajaji Tiger Reserve (RTR) during the current tourist season

title: Japanese delegation visits ISRO to review Chandrayaan-5/ LuPEX mission
content: The Chandrayaan-5 LuPEX mission is the fifth mission in the Chandrayaan series of lunar missions to study the lunar volatile materials, including lunar water, in the vicinity of a Permanently Shadowed Region in the lunar South pole

title: Cab drivers protest outside Uber centre in Bengaluru accusing the company of unfair practices
content: The protest, organised by members of the Bharath Transportation Group, alleged  that Uber is favouring fleet-attached vehicles over independent drivers

title: Genome Valley gets bioprocess design, scale-up facility
content: Minister Sridhar Babu, who opened the facility, said TGIIC is to undertake ₹200 crore infrastructure upgrades as the famous Life Sciences cluster of Hyderabad commemorates 25 years

title: Leadership issue: All eyes on Rahul Gandhi
content: Party sources say that Kharge is likely to brief Rahul Gandhi in a couple of days following which both Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar are likely to be called for consultation

title: Anaemia, malnutrition still rampant in Telangana’s Koya and Gond tribal communities
content: Recent ‘One Health’ outreach held in Bhadradri Kothagudem brings renewed attention to long-standing health inequities in some of the most remote forested regions in the State

title: ED raids three online gaming companies; freezes accounts with over ₹523 crore
content: The ED says it has found that WinZO continued operating real-money games in foreign markets such as the U.S., Brazil, and Germany, using the same platform as India- even after the nationwide ban on RMGs took effect on August 22, 2025

title: BWSSB opens wastewater treatment plants to start-ups to boost home-grown water innovation
content: BWSSB Chairman Ram Prasath Manohar says the move signals a new chapter in Bengaluru’s efforts to solve its water challenges using solutions emerging from within the city’s own ecosystem.

title: Delhi government, private offices to enforce 50% work from home due to high pollution
content: All private offices functioning within Delhi will operate with not more than 50% staff physically attending the workplace, while the remaining staff will “mandatorily” work from home

title: Newly formed Stadium division set to witness a high-profile contest
content: For UDF candidate Deepthi Mary Varghese, whose name is doing the rounds as a potential mayoral candidate, and LDF-backed Independent George Nanatt, Stadium, formed after delimitation, is a mix of their sitting divisions;  BDJS has fielded J. Asokan as NDA candidate

title: Maize growers stage protests in Kittur Karnataka
content: Farmers’ protest in districts of Kittur Karnataka have intensified. They are demanding an MSP of ₹3,000 a quintal. On Monday, several seers joined the protest in Haveri to express solidarity with the farmers

title: A.P. Government forms high-level panel of ten global experts to steer ‘Healthy Andhra Pradesh’ vision
content: Chief Minister clears an international advisory group tasked with shaping a comprehensive plan to strengthen public health systems and fast-track the State’s move towards becoming a model for health-centred governance

title: At ₹137.25 crore per acre, Neopolis shatters own record in HMDA e-auction
content: In August 2023, Neopolis plots fetched a record ₹100.75 crore per acre, but on Monday two marquee parcels in the same layout drew even higher bids, topping out at ₹137.25 crore per acre

title: 25 events to mark Veerendra Heggade’s birthday today
content: As many as 25 educational institutions in Hubballi-Dharwad will host the events to mark the Dharmadhikari’s 78th birthday celebrations

title: 47.35% SIR enumeration forms digitised, says Election Commission
content: At 76.89%, Goa reports highest digitisation, only 23% data, the lowest, uploaded from Kerala, says poll body; BLOs race against time, several find process confusing

title: SC directs quashing of criminal cases against Sandesara brothers in Sterling Biotech bank fraud case on condition of payment of ₹5100 crore by Dec. 17
content: These directions as issued are in peculiar facts of this case, therefore, they shall not be treated as precedent, the court clarified.

title: Andhra Pradesh launches ‘Raitanna Meekosam’ to boost farm sector
content: Agriculture Minister says the initiative focuses on water security, demand-driven crop planning, modern agri-technology, food processing and steady government support to make farming profitable and resilient

title: NCPCR leads State conference on child rights
content: NCPCR Member Secretary Sanjeev Sharma stresses need for addressing children’s mental health and said schools must play a central role in tackling psychological challenges

title: Pawan Kalyan inspects magic drain system in Eluru
content: Deputy Chief Minister inspects rural development works and launches major temple infrastructure projects worth ₹8.7 crore in the district

title: Ladakh violence: SC allows climate activist Wangchuk to join his wife in challenging NSA detention
content: Bench was earlier scheduled to hear a separate application filed by his wife alleging that Home Ministry was unhappy with Wangchuk’s participation in efforts to address government on Statehood, Sixth Schedule safeguards for Ladakh

title: Karnataka HC flags serious legal loophole in Kaveri 2.0 software as there is no facility to enter decrees of civil courts in land records
content: Directs State government to make changes to the software to ensure changes are reflected in land records based on decrees without delay

title: Naidu seeks extension to expedite digital protection of 14,000 Wakf properties in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Chief Minister urges the Centre to allow more time for updating Wakf records, with the State preparing data for thousands of assets to improve clarity, prevent disputes, and strengthen oversight

title: 96.22% of the electors given enumeration forms, says Tamil Nadu Chief Electoral Officer
content: Archana Patnaik says the forms were distributed by the Booth Level Officers to 6.16 crore voters as part of the Special Intensive Revision. And 50% of them have returned the forms filled up. The December 4 deadline will not be extended

title: Andhra Pradesh forms panel to push urban planning reforms
content: Six-member Working Group set up under MA&UD–SPAV partnership to strengthen planning, research and project preparation across municipal bodies and urban development agencies

title: Congress suffers early setback in Peringottukurissi after nominations of two candidates rejected
content: Nominations rejected for want of proper documents. Party facing big challenge from dissident leader and former district president A.V. Gopinathan in the local body

title: RJD issues notices to Bhojpuri singers for ‘offensive’ songs that ‘tarnished’ party’s image during Bihar election
content: RJD leaders says the party neither commissioned these songs nor authorised them to use the names of the party and its leaders. Some of these songs that went viral on social media during the election period suggested ‘Yadav caste supremacy’, which the ruling alliance used to warn people of ‘return of jungle raj’

title: Indian Navy commissions INS Mahe
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . INS Mahe is the first of the indigenously designed and built Mahe-class Anti-Submarine Warfare Shall .
